dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.0.2414

idCitation.resTitle: The Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program Spatial Data Indicators
idCitation.otherCitDet: Spatial Data Repository, The Demographic and Health Surveys Program. ICF International. Available from spatialdata.dhsprogram.com. [Accessed (please insert date of download DD MONTH YEAR)].

dataIdInfo.idPurp: Contains indicator values by sub-national region for the selected DHS Program surveys and indicators. Refer to the accompanying *csv document within the downloaded package for detailed a detailed indicator key and a summary of available data for the selected survey(s) and indicator(s).
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
As part of the Presidentâ€™s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) the PEPFAR supported Spatial Data Repository provides geographically based information on various Health and HIV indicators. STATcompiler provides the indicator data to populate the geographic information for the Spatial Data Repository. All data is from The Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program, which conducts nationally representative population-based surveys in over 89 countries. These surveys are representative at the sub national level (generally, 1st Administrative level). However, in some cases the sampling frame combines two or more 1st administrative areas or includes major cities as separate regions.

  • Administrative0 Boundaries source: US Department of State's Office of the Geographer (INR/GGI) - Small Scale International Boundaries (SSIB), Updated December 2011.

  • DHS Regions Internal Boundaries source: The DHS regions boundaries are created on a survey specific basis to correspond to the sampled areas of the survey, therefore the boundaries may not correspond to the Administrative1 or other official administrative boundaries of a country.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: USAID-funded The Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program: Produced by ICF International, USA. Refer to the final report online to determine the local implementing agencies for each survey: http://www.dhsprogram.com/Publications/Publication-Search.cfm

Data users should cite the Spatial Data Repository as the source of all derived reports, publications, presentations, or other products. To use the recommended citation, simply replace the date of download.

Spatial Data Repository, The Demographic and Health Surveys Program. ICF International.

Available from spatialdata.dhsprogram.com. [Accessed (please insert date of download DD MONTH YEAR)].

attr.attrdef: Two letter ISO country code
Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) 2 letter country code
Two letter DHS country code
three letter survey type i.e. DHS, MIS, AIS, SPA, or OTH (for all other survey types)
Four digit year of the survey. If the survey spanned more than one year, the primary survey year is assigned for this attribute.
Country name in English
Country Name in French
Country name in Spanish
DHS Region name in English
DHS Region name in French
DHS Region name in Spanish
3 digit survey identification code
Lists whether the survey is mappable at the sub-national level. NOTE: If this field is no, the geometry for the survey will be at the national level
Lists whether the survey is representative at multiple sub-national levels. NOTE: Urban/Rural status is considered to be a residence classification, not a sub-national level classification.
Ranks the sub-national level of represntativeness. Level 1 rank is the default display level for STATcompiler.com. Level 2 and 3 ranks are alternate levels of sub-national representation.

The variable name within the household recode file that aligns to the subnational level of representation. NOTE: this field will be "NULL" if the sub-national level does not align with a variable within the recode file or if the recode file is not in public domain

The variable code within the household recode file that aligns to the subnational level of representation. NOTE: this field will be "9999" if the sub-national area does not align with a variable within the recode file or the recode file is not in public domain.

The region name within the household recode file that aligns to the subnational level of representation. NOTE: this field will be "NULL" if the sub-national level does not align with a variable within the recode file or the recode file is not in public domain.

the variable name within the household recode file that lists another sub-national level of representativeness that may be formed by aggregating the areas. NOTE: This field will be "NULL" if the sub-national areas cannot be aggregated to align with another sub-national level of representation for the survey or the recode file is not in public domain.

The variable code within the household recode file that aligns to another sub-national level of representativeness that may be formed by aggregating the areas. NOTE: This field will be "9999" if the sub-national area cannot be aggregated to align with another sub-national level of representation for the survey or the recode file is not in public domain.

The region name within the household recode file that aligns to another sub-national level of representativeness that may be formed by aggregating the areas. NOTE: This field will be "NULL" if the sub-national area cannot be aggregated to align with another sub-national level of representation for the survey or the recode file is not in public domain.
The administrative description of the regions in the sub-national level. Admin1, Admin2, Admin1 and Capital City,Groups of Admin1, Groups of Admin2, Ecological Regions, Natural Regions, or Other
The country specific name for the level of administrative representativeness (i.e. zone, province, district, etc.)
Lists whether the sub-national level is representative for all of the survey indicators
Explanatory notes on the region and how it has changed over time.
Explanatory notes on all the sub-national boundaries of representativeness for the survey

If there is no data available for a selected indicator for the selected survey(s), the attribute field will be "null" in geodatabase format or "9999" in shapefile format. Please note that survey questionnaires vary by survey type and country, therefore not all indicators are available for all surveys. Refer to the data_availability.csv file to view whether the indicator(s) selected for this data package are available
Unique region identifier created by concatenating DHSCTRYCODE & SVYTYPE & SVYYEAR & CHAR_CAT_ID & CHAR_ID. NOTE: If the area is excluded from the survey, this field will be "Excluded".

overview.eaover: If there is no data available for a selected indicator for the selected survey(s), the attribute field will be "null" in geodatabase format or "9999" in shapefile format. Please note that survey questionnaires vary by survey type and country, therefore not all indicators are available for all surveys. Refer to the data_availability.csv file to view whether the indicator(s) selected for this data package are available
